study_details.study_name: Phase III, multicenter, randomized, placebo-controlled trial
study_details.key_findings: Benlysta was efficacious in controlling SLE symptoms with statistically significant improvements in SLE responder index scores compared to placebo by 76 weeks.
Benlysta use was associated with improved SLE symptoms when compared to placebo by 52 weeks.

rationale: The physician reviewer found that submitted documentation supports the medical necessity of the requested medication. The patient has a SELENA-SLEDAI score of 13 and has failed to respond to other standard drugs for SLE treatment. Studies support the efficacy of Benlysta in controlling SLE symptoms.
reviewer_credentials: Board certified in internal medicine with sub-specialty certification in rheumatology, actively practicing, and an expert in the treatment of the enrollee’s medical condition.
